The elevators felt like you were gonna drop down to the earth's core! Luckily we were on the fourth floor because the first floor, people were drinking and smoking. The bathrooms were disgusting! Cob webs and spider webs everywhere. The rest areas we stopped at on the way were better than that "DUMPSTER"

Reviews.Title: “It's the trashy party spring break hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Desert Inn was only a crappy party Spring Break hotel that should be cheaper becuase it is falling part...duct tape in the elevators to hold the lights up...classy! The vomit smell was a nice touch, and the stair well should never be allowed to have people go in because of the urine everywhere. Other than that...if you want to tear the place apart and not give a D$@# on Spring Break here is your place. Same ol' DJ everyday...same trashy contests...and a wonderful aroma to walk around in...The Desert Inn is your place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad of a place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Desert Inn several times, I alway go the week before Biketoberfest, I have found very few problems with it, the resturant is expensive, I don't like going to the desk to get ice, (should be an Ice machine on every floor). But I've had no bad times there and always got what I ask for from the desk and especially the maids. The person I took last year complained about the carpet being dirty, but you can't have everything spic and span.I like to have a good time as well as a lot of other people, but do it at decent hours,By the way, if it makes any difference, I'm in my early 50's, So just suck up and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People go to spring break for many reasons, reasons you will find at desert inn. This place lets kids get away with murder. People hanging off of balconies, yelling through megaphones and walking around with bottles of jaeger. Clearly the best time. If you want room service and clean sheets, go to the hilton. This hotel is "party" central with excellent poolside parties including beer relays and belly flop contests. There is also a meal plan one can accuire for $50. The food is good too. On my last night there, a water mane burst on the 3rd floor. --- was like old faithfull coming out of the wall. We were using the floor like a slip 'n slide. Everyone in the hotel was doing it. I only went out to the clubs 3 times out of the 7 nights. The hotel was too fun to leave. For the price, it is a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Party Central, but TERRIFYING!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and some frineds decided to stay here for spring break '04. The price was right and the parites were never ending. Unfortunately getting any assistance from the maids or security was impossible. It was kind of a -------- but we were free to do whatever we wanted. There was always entertainment out on the pool deck, the lobby was clean (no water on the floors) but there was a hoorible smell coming up from the parking garage, it was a mixture of warm beer and hot trash. Other than that it was a decent place to stay. However, the aladdin suite 2 floors below us was out of control. When beer bottles were being launched from their room to ours, through our glass doors, security was nowhere to be found. We couldn't stay in that room for obvious reasons and it took security 30 minutes to even get to their room. They were escorted out after 3 nights of anarchy, which wasn't soon ehough for us. We left a day early and didn't get our deposit back. On top of us leaving we had to take the stairs due to some violent behavior in the elavators, the screams coming from the hotel were so scary. This turned out to be the worst vacation. I would not recomend staying in this hotel for saftey resaons. It was terrifying.

Reviews.Title: “Partiers welcome, families not!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Desert Inn can either be awesome or completely awful. It depends on what you are going to Daytona to do. If you are going to party your *** off night and day, drink all you want, do whatever you want whenever you want, this is def. the place for you. This place is a non-stop party hotel and it's nothing but crazy drunk people running around doing whatever the hell they want to do! If you are going for a nice, peaceful, relaxing vacation with your family, then STAY AWAY! Parties don't stop at Desert Inn until about 6 in the morning, and that's no lie. The stuff written on the hotel about vomit everywhere and people breaking stuff and throwing things off the balconies are completely true! It's a very dirty place that has a weird odor to it like beer and throw up everywhere, but i've never had this much fun on Spring Break in my entire life! So to sum this up, partiers this is your place and families, like I said, STAY FAR AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “It was Absolutley disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: O my god, my boyfriend and i went down there for spring break, we drove 20 hrs from massachusetts, thinking we were going to this beautiful hotel we saw on the internet. This was the most disgusting place i have ever seen. First of all we were suppose to have an over sized delux room, the room was tiny, we probably had 2 feet in width to walk between the bed and the draws. There were holes in the wall, the bathroom looked like they literaly cut a hole in the wall and put a door on, there were cigarett butts on the floor, we were on the ground level and when we got there the window was open so we went to clese it and it fell off , so then we couldnt even close the window never mind lock it, you have to ask for ice behind the front desk, and the only safes they have are behing the desk so evry time we needed a lil money we had to go to the front desk, and the most disgusting thing of all was i walked out in the hall way and there were 2 dead cock roches, So if you are looking to stay at the Desert Inn dont be fooled by the picture on the web site it looks beautiful but when you get there it is really a run down dump.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went here for spring break for 4 days. It was so bad that everywhere i walked, was either a puddle of someones piss, or someones vomit. The rooms were diry, well...the whole place was dirty. But...it was a great party atmosphere, just standing in this hotel gets you wasted! Spring break 2003! WOO HOO

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Desert inn was absolutely disgusting! The Air conditionning did not work therefore the room was not only hot but humid as well! the bathroom did not have a ventilation system, so if someone showered, the steam would stay in the room for a long time and everything would be wet, hence the black mildew around the bathtub! Gross! i was promised a microwave and fridge, when we entered the room there was nothing to be seen. The ocean side view ended up being the street where bikers and loud cars would drive by at all hours of the night. The staff looked like zombies who couldn't care less about the establishment they work at. Our wake up call that we asked for never happened and our carpet never got vacuumed once!...please if you are thinking of the desert inn as a vacation spot...think again.. the pool may be nice but check out the pool's public bathroom and you'll reconsider the whole thing!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: Flharleygirl1508
Reviews.Content: After booking a 2 room suite for $375 per night, found ourselves in a 1 room filthy, sagging bed horror. Complained to management who, after initially being very rude, offerred to move us to a suite for $400 a night - a vastly discounted rate, I was told. Transferred into the "Alladin Suite" which was probably very nice - 20 years ago. Again, filthy, holes in the walls and the badly discolored ceiling, loose tiles in the bath floor, ancient saggy mattresses - I can't even describe how bad it was. Nieghbors partying and screaming until 4 AM and desperate calls (on old, busted up phones) to hotel "security" produced NOTHING. Paper thin walls - not peace for the 2 nights we were there. The big feature of the room was a big jacuzzi tub which we never touched and a big balcony which was so dirty you had to have shoes on to walk on it, dodging the cigar butts and beer bottles the people next door left on OUR balcony. The common halls of the place were no better - worn, filthy carpet, Huge bags of trash left in the hallways all night, broken glass on the floor in the elevator hall - we tried desperately to get another motel but it was bike week and everything was booked. Next time I will sleep on the beach before I ever go near this place again.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time and never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been to the Desert Inn on 3 occassions, this by far was the worst, the only reason we went back was we saw on the website where they did many renovations. The only advantage to this property is its close enough to walk to places in Daytona for night life, but the hotel complex itself is a disaster with the exception of the pool. To start with our truck was broken into in the parking garage and items stolen the very first night there, and management could have cared less, and wouldnt even review the garage tapes to see if anything was visible or may have been recorded. They wouldnt call the police, we had to drive over to the Police Station to make the report. We had rented two oceanfront rooms both with kitchenettes, which the kitchens had missing ceiling tiles, drawers just hanging in the openings, and just generally dirty. Had this been during or right after bike week or spring break it'd be understandable, but this was the 1st week of August. The door handle on the slider to the balcony of our bedroom broke off in our hand, when we went to open the door, and when it rained, the carpet in front of the slider was soaked almost 2 feet into the room. We had two young ladies squat in front of our adjoining room and relieve themselves in the hall, and it ran under the door into the room, we called housekeeping to clean it up, but they never showed up. We ended up cleaning it up ourselves, we understand they cant control the guests but at least clean up after them in those type of circumstances. We ride bikes and not much bothers us, but this place for a hotel is much closer to a rally site campground than a hotel. It needs to be completely revamped totally, or torn down and completely redone, its lived beyond its prime...........but then again I'm not too sure Daytona Beach hasn't exceeded its prime also, time to find another vacation spot. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family summer '03. The staff was very sweet, especially the maintenance man! If I had any questions someone always knew the answer. I am going again on Spring Break '04 and will not stay anywhere else! It was convenient to have all of the amenities they offer work, unlike other hotels I stayed at in Daytona, and I am there every summer. I feel bad for the people who had a bad stay, because the staff and the room made it worth my while to stay. I won't stay anywhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Desert Inn Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 900 North Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
